posts.name: Sano Patrick
posts.cooked:
I have been trying to deploy signal server on premise, but I am having trouble to build latest signal server.
when I checkout main branch, and try to build it: mvn clean install or mvn -DskipTests package, everything seems to have gone right, I even go in build logs and there no error. but the created jar files seem incomplete. barely 3MB, but when I build version 6.9,5.97,4.97, every is is ok
when I try to run that jar with java -jar jarful.jar server config.yaml , I get the error
no main manifest attribute, in jarfil.jar . which tells me that , the build was incomplete.
so my question is , can someone help me? anything I am doing wrong ?

build1920×1200 169 KB

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked: What version of java are you using. I am successfully building and running (sort of) 12.3.0 and the jar files are much larger than yours. I am using java 21.

posts.name: jeevan bisht
posts.cooked:
sanop:

no main manifest attribute

Hi @jgnoonan1961

not able to run any single jar file, same error for all of these. Do you have any idea what should i debug next, i have tried few things like added main class path in xml file like below, but its not helping either

org.apache.maven.plugins maven-jar-plugin

                <execution>
                    <id>default-jar</id>
                    <goals>

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked: I start the server from the command line and one of the parameters I pass is the location of sample.yml, located in service/config. I’m not in my office right now, but will send you the full command as soon as I return.

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked:
Here is the java command I use to start the server:

java -jar -Dsoftware.amazon.awssdk.http.async.service.impl=software.amazon.awssdk.http.crt.AwsCrtSdkHttpService -Dsecrets.bundle.filename=service/config/sample-secrets-bundle.yml service/target/TextSecureServer-12.43.0.jar server service/config/sample.yml

It took a long time to get sample.yml and sample-secrets-bundle.yml correct so that the server will start. The server start code runs a config test and if the config is wrong, it will fail with very unhelpful error messages. I’ve been working on this for three months and I have the server, registration server, and nginx running and I am running the Android client inside Android Studio from my Mac. I am able to connect to my server, enter my phone number, enter the verification code from the registration server, and then I get an error that it can’t create an account record in DynamoDB. It is creating a PhoneNumberIdentifier record, so the pieces are talking to one another, but I can’t seem to figure out why it won’t create a accounts record. Best of luck to you!

posts.name: jeevan bisht
posts.cooked: @jgnoonan1961 thanks for the answer. Now i am deploying same version 12.3.0 as your and working on completing sample.yml file of mine. But again one thing which i am worry about the error message i am receiving “no main manifest attribute” looks like the jar i am running is not able to detect the main method. but again as per you the message may be not that helpful. I am trying if i will stuck i will ask for help again. Thanks again.

posts.cooked: What size is the compiled jar file?

posts.cooked:
@jgnoonan1961 here is the size of jar files.

service
${project.version}

${project.version}

these are not found, this can be the issue, because i have created a sample.yml file with having the keys and credentials now. but getting same error

no main manifest attribute, in TextSecureServer-12.45.1-dirty-SNAPSHOT.jar
i want to run this server locally as well but i don’t know how i will do that with so many issues i am facing.

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked:
It looks like the files didn’t compile properly. Here is the command I use to build the files:

./mvnw clean install -DskipTests -Djgitver.use-version=12.43.0 -Pexclude-spam-filter

This produces the following files:

api-doc-12.43.0.jar - same size as yours
integration-tests-12.43.0.jar - same size as yours
TextSecureServer-12.43.0.jar - 159.34 MB (much bigger than yours)
websocket-resources-12.43.0.jar - same size as yours

The TextSecureServer-12.43.0.jar is the main jar file for starting the server. It clearly didn’t build correctly. The first two things I would look at are your maven and Java versions. Mine are as follows:

mvn --version = 3.9.6
java --version = 21.0.2

I am using Ubuntu 22.4. I had to manually install the latest maven version because the sudo apt install maven installed a much lower version. I don’t know what OS you’re running but you can google manual install maven for your OS. Once I got the versions correct, the system built properly. You should get the following message at the end of the build process:

------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Reactor Summary for TextSecureServer 12.43.0:

[INFO]

[INFO] TextSecureServer … SUCCESS [ 2.015 s]

[INFO] websocket-resources … SUCCESS [ 5.929 s]

[INFO] service … SUCCESS [ 54.821 s]

[INFO] api-doc … SUCCESS [ 3.182 s]

[INFO] integration-tests … SUCCESS [ 1.001 s]

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Total time: 01:09 min

[INFO] Finished at: 2024-05-21T12:44:55Z

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

Also, part of the compile process is to validate the keys in sample.yml. So if any keys are missing or incorrect, the build will fail. I am running this on an AWS EC2 instance size t2.xlarge. Let me know if you have any questions.

posts.cooked:

can i run it on my local machine for debugging purpose with the minimal keys?
how can i open it’s swagger or open api doc?

I’m also trying to compile the latest version of the server and would like to write a proper documentation for any other members that could be in the same situation, as there is no “manual” for it.

Is there a way we can work together?

posts.name: jeevan bisht
posts.cooked:
Hi @John_Terry @jgnoonan1961 can you please tell me the steps to generate these.

credentialConfigurationJson: |
{
}

i have started the Registration server using dev environment and its running on 50051 but not able to figure out how to generate the credentialConfigurationJson. i have created the cognito user pool in AWS and selected google as identity provider, it is asking clientId and Secret for this.
Now i have to create OAuth client ID in Google cloud, but i don’t know the exact step how to do it. Can you please explain a little bit about it why we are doing this exactly? are you following any doc? i have already created the certificate and reverse proxy in nginx as well for both the signal 443 port and registration server 442 port. but the OAuth client part of GCM i am not able to figure out.

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked: Sure. If you go to Google Cloud and go to APIs, and then select the Credentials option. Click on your OAuth2 identity and on the right near the client id field, you should see a download symbol. Download the file, and cut and paste the contents into that section in the sample.yml. There may be additional configuration work, but start with that.

posts.name: jeevan bisht
posts.cooked:
Hi @jgnoonan1961 Thanks, I have created it and add the config in sample.yml file. now the error is changed and i am debugging it. What exactly i did is, create a Workload Identity Pools in google cloud while creating, it asked me the provider, i selected AWS as provider and paste AWS Account ID in account id field and download the json.
Now i am getting the error for captcha.RecaptchaClient
My question is, is it mandatory to fill all the configuration in sample.yml?

posts.name: jeevan bisht
posts.cooked:
i use google cloud service account JSON in recaptcha as well and the captcha.RecaptchaClient error gone. but now i am facing the error in zkgroup. the exact error is

org.signal.libsignal.zkgroup.InvalidInputException: Deserialization failure in zkgroup
at org.signal.libsignal.internal.Native.GenericServerSecretParams_CheckValidContents(Native Method)
at org.signal.libsignal.zkgroup.GenericServerSecretParams.(GenericServerSecretParams.java:35)
at org.whispersystems.textsecuregcm.WhisperServerService.run(WhisperServerService.java:639)
at org.whispersystems.textsecuregcm.WhisperServerService.run(WhisperServerService.java:238)
at io.dropwizard.cli.EnvironmentCommand.run(EnvironmentCommand.java:59)
at io.dropwizard.cli.ConfiguredCommand.run(ConfiguredCommand.java:98)
at io.dropwizard.cli.Cli.run(Cli.java:78)
at io.dropwizard.Application.run(Application.java:94)
at org.whispersystems.textsecuregcm.WhisperServerService.main(WhisperServerService.java:878)

Again the same question why this is necessary? @jgnoonan1961 did you configure this as well?

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked: Yes. I am not home right now. I will send you instructions on how to generate this when I get home.

posts.name: Joe
posts.cooked:
To fix this error, do the following:

In order to resolve this, you need to download the git repo for libsignal and build it. Once it is built, go to libsignal/rust/zkgroup/bin and run the following command:

`cargo run --features="base64" --bin generate_generic_server_params`

place the generated key in Signal-Server/service/config/sample-secrets-bundle.yml in the following keys:

genericZkConfig.serverSecret:
callingZkConfig.serverSecret:
backupsZkConfig.serverSecret:

This will resolve your problem
